attributes.action: We want mental health awareness to become part of the school national curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
Because we would like the government to recognise that this a valid issue young people especially during the pandemic. 1 in 6 young people aged 5-16 are suffering with mental health problems. And 75% of young people with mental health problems are not getting the support they need. (stats: childrenssociety.org 19th January 2021) 

We feel that these statistics are unacceptable and we would like support in educating young people as we believe this will only get worse.
attributes.background: We want the government to take on board the importance of raising mental health issues amongst young people aged 5years-18years old. And to become embedded in young peoples life's and provide a range of resources and support to enable young people to build coping strategies and resilience.
